results.title: Fabric of change
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
This video discusses the effect of restructuring in the textiles, clothing and footwear industries. Removal of tarrif barriers by 1995 may lead to retrenchment of workers, many of whom are migrant women. The industries must modernise and become more productive if they are to survive. The resource notes accompanying the video are student centred (Years 10-12), particularly for those doing Economics, Commerce and Business Studies.

results.title: Fabienne
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Andre Belleau and Jacques Godbout
results.brief_description: She is a night club entertainer, in her way a highly successful exponent of her art, but there are moments when the admiration of her Montreal following is not enough. “Fabienne” is the portrait of a woman who has achieved enviable fame but is still far from content. (Award: Evian) Credits include: photographer by Guy Borremans; editing by Jacques Godbout, Gilles Groulx; music by Pierre Letourneau and sound by Joseph Champagne.

results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Debbie Packham, Christine Wardale, Jack White and Phillip Healy

results.title: F1 world 98
results.brief_description: This video gives an insight into Formula One, away from the racetrack as it goes behind the scenes during the 1998 season. Some of the best drivers are interviewed, including Mika Hakkinen, David Coulthard, Alex Zanardi and Jacques Villeneuve. The design, technical and commercial strategies of teams are analysed by talking to designers and managers. The programme shows cutting edge technology, such as the amazing Ferrari wind tunnel at Miranello. Some of the newest and best teams are profiled and there’s footage of the best drivers in action, such as Mick Doohan and Tommi Makinen. Narrated by Richard Nichols.

results.title: F.I.D.O. = Fido
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Steve Sculley
results.brief_description: Told from the point of view of Harry, a black labrador, F.I.D.O. follows the controversial path of the Fairfield Industrial Design Object - appropriately named F.I.D.O. The project materialises itself in real life in the form of a proposed public art structure - a 6 metre high dog with lights and a moving tail. We hear from the artists themselves, outraged residents who feel like they have been left out of the democratic process, and a supportive Darebin Council member. Regardless of the outcome and opinions expressed, two things remain - there are a lot of dogs in the City of Darebin, and the face of Fairfield is changing.

results.title: F.H. Greenway
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Behind the Legend”.
Introduced by Manning Clarke, the film proficiently reconstructs the story of Francis Greenway’s relationship and court case with Edward Sanderson of the N.S.W. Corps, and gives glimpses of the conditions in the colony under the Governorship of Macquarie. Written by Joanne Bean, the cast includes John Ewart as Francis Greenway and Nick Tate as Captain Sanderson.

results.title: F.D.R. 1882-1945
results.brief_description: A tribute to Franklin Delano Roosevelt, four times President of the United States, born 1882, died 1945, one of the most famous Americans. Using archival footage, the film gives an interesting insight into modern American history.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1967
results.brief_description: A brilliant finale to the 1967 British football season between the two London teams, Tottenham Hotspurs and Chelsea as they battle it out for the FA Cup at Wembley Stadium.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1965: soccer honours its greatest star
results.brief_description: A record of the 1965 FA Cup Final between two of England’s most famous soccer clubs, Liverpool and Leeds. Includes some background material on Sir Stanley Matthews, showing him with footballers from overseas who were visiting England to participate in celebrations marking his retirement from football and the Queen presenting the Cup.
